newsitem.title: INDIA: India allows free import of some rice varieties.
newsitem.headline: India allows free import of some rice varieties.

text.p: The Indian government said on Thursday it has allowed the free import of common and coarse grades of rice, and rice with 50 percent or more broken content.
A Commerce Ministry statement said free imports of these rice varieties had been permitted after reviewing the supply trends and stocks.
A ministry spokeswoman said the government wanted to ensure that rice varieties consumed by the poor and underprivileged were made available freely.
India presently allows the free export of aromatic Basmati, as well as fine and superfine varieties of rice.
India's 1996/97 kharif, or winter, crop sown in July and harvested in October has been estimated at 71.27 million tonnes.
India produced 79.49 million tonnes of rice in 1995/96 (July-June), down from 81.16 million in 1994/95.
